subject: Re: [junit] German book on Junit and test first ready for review
msgSnippet: ... One certainly could write another 100+ pages about Junit (BTW, there s another chapter in the book which covers some Junit internals) but IMO the general
messageBody:
> I haven't read the entire book (did quick overview + read the chapter about
> JUnit) but this book presents the testing methodology and not only JUnit. I
> don't think that you can write 200+ pages about JUnit. The chapter about
> JUnit is about 20 pages and describes how to write a test case, a suite and
> execute tests. Nothing new if you have access to the documentation.

One certainly could write another 100+ pages about Junit (BTW, there's
another chapter in the book which covers some Junit internals) but IMO
the general techniques are more important than the tool itself.

> What is more interesting about this book is the presentation of several
> testing methods (mock objects for ex.). I think this book is worth reading
> but if you don't want to learn German (...) you will find plenty of other
> books written in a language you better understand.

There *may be* an English translation sometime next year but I hope that
other books about test first and the application of Junit will be
published by then. The english speaking XP community is so numerous that
everything else would be a shame...

Johannes
